intro: Physospermopsis siamensis, commonly known as the Siam physosperm, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
